title: BACnetClientCreateObject (FunctionBlock)
text:
FUNCTION_BLOCK PUBLIC FINAL BACnetClientCreateObject EXTENDS
BACnetClientBase
Common Behaviour Model conform (ETrigA) FB to execute a Create-Object-Reqeust in the BACnet-Network.
If execution completed successfully and xDone is TRUE,CreateObjectID holds mthe ID of the created object.
If the request fails, firstFailed holds the index of the first property, due to which reason the
creation failed.

rows.Name: xExecute
rows.Comment: Rising edge: Starts defined operationFALSE: Resets the defined operation after ready condition was reached

rows:
Max. operating time for executing
[Âµs], 0: No operating time limit

rows.Name: dwTargetDeviceNumber
rows.Comment:
The device number of the targeted device in the BACnet-
Network.

rows:
Optional: The device address of the targeted device in the BACnet-Network. If
an adress is given the given device number is ignored.

rows.Name: eStatus
rows.Comment: If an error occured, the error state.

rows:
If an error occured (this means eStatus <> BACNET_STATUS_OK), whereas the sent BACnet-Request was answered
with an specific error information, the latter is contained in this structure.

The State in which the FB is during execution:0: No execution, resetted state1: Searching for the Target-Device and a valid address for it2: Sending the BACnet-Request into the network3: Waiting for the answer (if there is one) to the BACnet-Request made in 24: Finishing the call, setting of the output variables

rows.Name: objectSpecifier
rows.Comment:
This parameter contains information about the type of object that is to be
created. The datatype is a choice between an object type and an object
identifier. If the object type choice is used, the specified object type
shall become the value of the Object_Type property of the newly created
object and the responding BACnet-user shall select an object identifier.
If the object identifier choice is used, an object with this particular
object identifier shall be created.

rows: If set to True the list of initial values is valid.
Number of entries in the list of initial values.

This parameter contains a list of BACnetPropertyValues that will be used to
initialize the values of the specified properties of the newly created
object.

rows.Name: createdObjectID
rows.Comment:
If the BACnet-Request succeeded (xDone is TRUE and no error occured (xError is FALSE)), this
variable holds the object ID of the created object.

rows:
If the BACnet-Request failed, this variable shall hold the first property, for which the creation of
the object failed.
